data.why:
A collection of Module building blocks very useful for web
    applications. Currently about 2000 lines worth. These modules
    themselves don't actually output any html.

    Comming next will a collection of modules using the previous ones
    to actualy create "standard" web applications. Some of these include
    WWWBoards, Configuration Systems, Form Builders, ...etc.

    Most notably, DB::SQL::*.pm contains modules to translate the SQL
    itself to specific database engines for use along with Tim Bunces
    DBI. (dates, nulls, outerjoins, concats)

    A subclass of CGI with added date/time methods for creating
    completely configurable date/time form elements _easily_.

    Thanks the the hard work.
